panels.title: Pass Rate
panels.description: Percentage of datapoints sent vs received (sent/received * 100)

panels.title: Datapoints/sec
panels.description: Rate of datapoints processed per second across all metrics

panels.title: Unique Metrics
panels.description: Total number of unique metric names currently being tracked

panels.title: Total Cardinality
panels.description: Total unique time series across all metrics (sum of all metric cardinalities)

panels.title: Queue Size
panels.description: Current number of batches in the retry queue waiting to be sent

panels.title: Export Errors
panels.description: Export errors in the last 5 minutes - indicates backend connectivity issues

panels.title: Dropped/s
panels.description: Datapoints per second being dropped due to limits enforcement

panels.title: Drop Rate %
panels.description: Percentage of datapoints being dropped (dropped / (dropped + passed))

panels.title: Exported/s
panels.description: Datapoints per second successfully exported to backend

panels.title: Groups Dropped
panels.description: Number of label groups currently being dropped by adaptive limiting

panels.title: Datapoints Rate
panels.description: OTLP datapoints flow: received from clients, sent to backend, dropped by limits

panels.title: Batches & Exports
panels.description: OTLP export batch rate and error rate to the configured backend

panels.title: OTLP Export Errors by Type
panels.description:
Breakdown of OTLP export errors by error type (stacked). Error types help identify root cause:

- **network**: Connection refused, DNS failures, connection reset - check network connectivity and backend availability
- **timeout**: Request timeouts - increase exporter timeout or check backend latency
- **server_error**: 5xx HTTP status - backend is overloaded or failing
- **auth**: 401/403 status - check credentials and permissions
- **rate_limit**: 429 status - backend is rate limiting, reduce send rate
- **client_error**: 4xx status (except auth/rate_limit) - check request format
- **unknown**: Unclassified errors - check logs for details

panels.title: OTLP Retry Failures by Type
panels.description:
Breakdown of OTLP queue retry failures by error type (stacked). These are errors that occurred during retry attempts from the OTLP queue.

High values indicate the backend is consistently failing. Combined with circuit breaker state, this helps understand:
- If retries are being attempted (circuit closed/half-open)
- What types of errors are causing failures
- Whether the backend is recovering or still unhealthy

panels.title: OTLP Datapoints Exported/s
panels.description: Rate of OTLP datapoints successfully exported to the backend. This metric tracks actual datapoints (not batches) that were accepted by the backend without errors.

panels.title: OTLP Export Errors/s
panels.description: Total OTLP export error rate across all error types. High values indicate export failures. Check 'OTLP Export Errors by Type' panel for breakdown of error causes.

panels.title: OTLP Retry Success Rate
panels.description:
Percentage of OTLP queue retries that succeed. Formula: retries_success / (retries_success + retries_failure) * 100.

Values:
- Green (>90%): Backend is healthy, occasional failures are expected
- Yellow (50-90%): Backend is struggling, check for issues
- Red (<50%): Backend is unhealthy, most retries fail

panels.title: OTLP Export Requests/s
panels.description: Rate of OTLP export requests sent to the backend. Each request contains one batch of datapoints.

panels.title: PRW Datapoints Rate
panels.description: Prometheus Remote Write datapoints received and sent per second

panels.title: PRW Timeseries & Batches
panels.description: PRW unique timeseries, batch throughput and export errors. Shows the flow of timeseries through the PRW pipeline. Compare received vs sent to identify drops. Export errors indicate backend connectivity issues.

panels.title: PRW Export Errors by Type
panels.description:
Breakdown of PRW export errors by error type (stacked). Error types help identify root cause:

- **network**: Connection refused, DNS failures, connection reset - check network connectivity and backend availability
- **timeout**: Request timeouts - increase exporter timeout or check backend latency
- **server_error**: 5xx HTTP status - backend is overloaded or failing
- **auth**: 401/403 status - check credentials and permissions
- **rate_limit**: 429 status - backend is rate limiting, reduce send rate
- **client_error**: 4xx status (except auth/rate_limit) - check request format
- **unknown**: Unclassified errors - check logs for details

panels.title: PRW Retry Failures by Type
panels.description:
Breakdown of PRW queue retry failures by error type (stacked). These are errors that occurred during retry attempts from the PRW queue.

High values indicate the backend is consistently failing. Combined with circuit breaker state, this helps understand:
- If retries are being attempted (circuit closed/half-open)
- What types of errors are causing failures
- Whether the backend is recovering or still unhealthy

panels.title: PRW Samples Exported/s
panels.description: Rate of PRW samples/datapoints successfully exported to the backend. This metric tracks actual samples (not timeseries) that were accepted by the backend without errors.

panels.title: PRW Export Errors/s
panels.description: Total PRW export error rate across all error types. High values indicate export failures. Check 'PRW Export Errors by Type' panel for breakdown of error causes.

panels.title: PRW Retry Success Rate
panels.description:
Percentage of PRW queue retries that succeed. Formula: retries_success / (retries_success + retries_failure) * 100.

Values:
- Green (>90%): Backend is healthy, occasional failures are expected
- Yellow (50-90%): Backend is struggling, check for issues
- Red (<50%): Backend is unhealthy, most retries fail

panels.title: PRW Timeseries Exported/s
panels.description: Rate of PRW timeseries successfully exported. This counts unique timeseries per export request, not individual samples.

panels.title: PRW Bytes Rate
panels.description: PRW bytes per second by direction and compression state

panels.title: OTLP Bytes Rate
panels.description: OTLP bytes per second by direction and compression state (includes gRPC wire-level compression)

panels.title: Compression Savings
panels.description: Percentage of bytes saved by compression (higher is better)

panels.title: Buffer Size
panels.description: Current buffer size by protocol (timeseries count)

panels.title: Limit Violations by Rule
panels.description: Rate of limit violations (cardinality or datapoints exceeded) per rule

panels.title: Dropped vs Passed by Rule
panels.description: Datapoints passed vs dropped per rule - shows enforcement impact

panels.title: Drop Rate % Over Time
panels.description: Percentage of datapoints dropped over time - effective savings from limits

panels.title: Total Dropped Datapoints
panels.description: Cumulative datapoints dropped by rule - shows total savings

panels.title: Current Cardinality by Rule
panels.description: Current unique series count per rule (vs configured max_cardinality)

panels.title: Dropped Groups by Rule (Adaptive)
panels.description: Groups currently being dropped by adaptive limiting - identifies top offenders

panels.title: Datapoints Dropped Rate (by Rule & Action)
panels.description: Rate of datapoints being dropped, color-coded by action type (red=drop, orange=adaptive)

panels.title: Groups Being Dropped Rate (by Rule)
panels.description: Rate of groups being dropped by each rule - shows which rules are actively limiting traffic

panels.title: Rule Status Overview
panels.description: All rules with current cardinality vs limit, usage percentage, and groups dropped. Sorted by usage to highlight rules near or over limits.

panels.title: Top 10 Metrics by Cardinality
panels.description: Metrics with the most unique label combinations (highest series count)

panels.title: Top 10 Metrics by Datapoints/s
panels.description: Metrics generating the most datapoints per second (highest throughput)

panels.title: Cardinality Mode
panels.description: Active cardinality tracking mode. BLOOM (green) = memory-efficient probabilistic tracking with ~1% false positive rate. EXACT (yellow) = map-based tracking with 100% accuracy but higher memory usage. Bloom mode provides 98% memory savings.

panels.title: Total Bloom Memory
panels.description: Combined memory usage of all Bloom filter cardinality trackers. Includes both stats collector trackers (per-metric tracking) and limits enforcer trackers (per-rule/group tracking). Green < 10MB, Yellow < 100MB, Red >= 100MB.

panels.title: Memory Savings
panels.description: Percentage of memory saved by using Bloom filters instead of maps. Calculated as: 1 - (actual_bloom_memory / estimated_map_memory). Values > 95% (green) indicate optimal Bloom filter performance.

panels.title: Total Trackers
panels.description: Total number of active Bloom filter trackers. Each unique metric name gets one tracker in stats, and each rule/group combination gets one tracker in limits.

panels.title: Memory by Limits Rule
panels.description: Memory usage breakdown by limits rule. Each rule tracks cardinality per group. Use to identify which rules consume the most resources.

panels.title: Bloom Filter Configuration
panels.description: Current Bloom filter configuration values. Expected Items: target number of unique series per tracker. FP Rate: target false positive rate (default: 0.01 = 1%).

panels.title: Queue Size
panels.description: Current queue size vs maximum configured size (batches count)

panels.title: Queue Operations
panels.description: Queue operations: pushes (failures queued), drops (queue full), retries

panels.title: Queue Bytes & Disk
panels.description: Queue bytes usage and available disk space

panels.title: FastQueue & Retry Operations
panels.description: FastQueue operations (meta syncs, chunk rotations, flushes) and retry rates

panels.title: Queue Utilization
panels.description: Queue utilization ratio (0-1, where 1 = full)

panels.title: Dropped by Reason
panels.description: Dropped batches by reason (queue full, disk full, etc)

panels.title: FastQueue Storage
panels.description: FastQueue in-memory and disk storage usage

panels.title: Export Batches & Errors
panels.description: Overall export batches and errors rate. Shows successful batch sends vs total errors. Errors breakdown by type available in 'Export Errors by Type' panel. High error rates indicate connectivity or backend issues - check the error type breakdown for root cause analysis.

panels.title: Export Errors by Type
panels.description:
Breakdown of export errors by error type (stacked). Error types help identify root cause:

- **network**: Connection refused, DNS failures, connection reset - check network connectivity and backend availability
- **timeout**: Request timeouts - increase exporter timeout or check backend latency
- **server_error**: 5xx HTTP status or gRPC Internal/Unavailable - backend is overloaded or failing
- **auth**: 401/403 status or Unauthenticated - check credentials and permissions
- **rate_limit**: 429 status or ResourceExhausted - backend is rate limiting, reduce send rate
- **client_error**: 4xx status (except auth/rate_limit) - check request format
- **unknown**: Unclassified errors - check logs for details

panels.title: Queue Retry Failures by Type
panels.description:
Breakdown of queue retry failures by error type (stacked). These are errors that occurred during retry attempts from the persistent queue.

High values indicate the backend is consistently failing. Combined with circuit breaker state, this helps understand:
- If retries are being attempted (circuit closed/half-open)
- What types of errors are causing failures
- Whether the backend is recovering or still unhealthy

Compare with 'Export Errors by Type' to see if initial exports and retries fail for the same reasons.

panels.title: Batch Splits & Retry Rate
panels.description: Rate of batch splits during export. Batch splits occur when the export payload is too large and must be divided. High rates may indicate batch_max_size is set too high relative to backend limits.

panels.title: Batch Size Distribution
panels.description: Average batch size in bytes and rate of oversized batches. Use this to tune batch_max_size configuration. If 'Too Large' rate is high, reduce batch_max_size.

panels.title: Datapoints Exported/s
panels.description:
Rate of datapoints successfully exported to the backend. This metric tracks actual datapoints (not batches) that were accepted by the backend without errors.

Compare with 'Datapoints/sec' (received) to see export success rate. If exported rate is significantly lower than received rate, data is being dropped or queued.

panels.title: Export Errors/s
panels.description: Total export error rate across all error types. High values indicate export failures. Check 'Export Errors by Type' panel for breakdown of error causes.

panels.title: Retry Failures/s
panels.description:
Total queue retry failure rate. These are batches that failed to export during retry attempts. High values indicate persistent backend issues.

Compare with 'Retry Attempts/s' to calculate retry success rate. If failures >> successes, the backend may be unhealthy.

panels.title: Retry Success Rate
panels.description:
Percentage of queue retries that succeed. Formula: retries_success / (retries_success + retries_failure) * 100.

Values:
- Green (>90%): Backend is healthy, occasional failures are expected
- Yellow (50-90%): Backend is struggling, check for issues
- Red (<50%): Backend is unhealthy, most retries fail

panels.title: FastQueue In-Memory Blocks
panels.description: Current number of blocks in the in-memory channel (spills to disk when full)

panels.title: FastQueue Disk Bytes
panels.description: Current bytes stored on disk by FastQueue (spilled from in-memory channel)

panels.title: FastQueue Operations
panels.description: FastQueue metadata syncs, chunk rotations, and memory flushes

panels.title: Queue Throughput
panels.description: Queue push, drop, and retry rates per second

panels.title: Queue Drops by Reason
panels.description: Queue drops by reason (full, disk_full, etc.)

panels.title: Circuit State
panels.description: Current circuit breaker state. Closed = normal operation, Open = blocking retries due to consecutive failures, Half-Open = testing if backend recovered

panels.title: Current Backoff
panels.description: Current exponential backoff delay between retry attempts. Increases on failures, resets on success. Higher values mean longer waits between retries.

panels.title: Circuit Opens
panels.description: Total number of times the circuit breaker has opened due to consecutive failures. High values indicate persistent backend issues.

panels.title: Rejected by Circuit
panels.description: Total retry requests rejected because the circuit breaker was open. Prevents wasting resources on a failing backend.

panels.title: Circuit Breaker State Over Time
panels.description: Shows circuit breaker state transitions over time. Value 1 means that state is active. Closed = healthy, Open = blocking retries, Half-Open = recovery probe

panels.title: Backoff Delay Over Time
panels.description: Tracks how the exponential backoff delay changes over time. Increases with consecutive failures (multiplied by backoff multiplier), resets to base delay on successful retry.

panels.title: Circuit Breaker Events
panels.description: Rate of circuit breaker events: opens (circuit tripped due to failures) and rejections (retry blocked by open circuit). Spikes indicate backend stability issues.

panels.title: Retry Success Rate
panels.description: Comparison of total retry attempts vs successful retries. A healthy system should show retries eventually succeeding. Persistent gaps indicate backend issues.

panels.title: Active Endpoints
panels.description: Number of backend endpoints discovered via DNS for sharding

panels.title: Datapoints by Endpoint
panels.description: Distribution of datapoints across sharded endpoints (should be balanced)

panels.title: DNS & Rehash Events
panels.description: DNS discovery refreshes, consistent hash ring rebuilds, and DNS errors

panels.title: DNS Lookup Latency
panels.description: DNS lookup latency for sharding endpoint discovery

panels.title: Export Latency by Endpoint
panels.description: Time to export metrics to each sharding endpoint

panels.title: Export Errors by Endpoint
panels.description: Export errors per sharding endpoint - helps identify unhealthy endpoints

panels.title: PSI Some (10s avg)
panels.description: Percentage of time tasks are delayed due to resource pressure (some = at least one task)

panels.title: PSI Full (10s avg)
panels.description: Percentage of time ALL tasks are delayed (full stall - more severe)

panels.title: Disk I/O Rate
panels.description: Process disk read/write bytes per second

panels.title: Disk I/O Syscalls
panels.description: Process read/write syscalls per second

panels.title: Network Throughput
panels.description: Network bytes per second (all interfaces except loopback)

panels.title: Network Packets
panels.description: Network packets per second

panels.title: Network Errors & Drops
panels.description: Network errors and dropped packets per second

panels.title: Goroutines
panels.description: Active goroutines and OS threads in the metrics-governor process

panels.title: Heap Memory
panels.description: Detailed heap memory breakdown: allocated, in-use, system reserved, idle, and released back to OS

panels.title: Memory Overview
panels.description: High-level memory usage: total allocated, system memory, and stack usage

panels.title: Heap Objects & Allocations
panels.description: Heap object count and allocation/free rates. High churn (mallocs - frees) creates GC pressure.

panels.title: GC Cycles
panels.description: Rate of garbage collection cycles per second

panels.title: GC Pause Time
panels.description: GC pause duration: total pause rate and last individual pause duration

panels.title: GC CPU %
panels.description: Percentage of CPU time spent in garbage collection. High values (>5%) indicate GC pressure.

panels.title: Process CPU Usage
panels.description: CPU usage percentage (100% = 1 core fully utilized)
Rule cache hit rate. After warm-up, should stabilize above 90%.
panels.title: Rule Cache Hit Rate

panels.description: Current entries in rule cache vs configured max.
panels.title: Rule Cache Size

panels.description: Cached 'no rule matches' entries.
panels.title: Rule Cache Negative Entries

panels.description: Rule cache operations per second.
panels.title: Rule Cache Operations/s

panels.description: Compression pool operations per second.
panels.title: Compression Pool Operations/s

panels.description: Ratio of returned vs acquired compression pool objects.
panels.title: Compression Pool Reuse Ratio

panels.description: String intern pool operations per second.
panels.title: String Intern Pool Ops/s

panels.description: Unique strings in intern pool.
panels.title: String Intern Pool Size

panels.description: Series key pool operations per second.
panels.title: Series Key Pool Ops/s

panels.description: Compression buffer pool operations per second.
panels.title: Buffer Pool Ops/s
